name: Riley Kapoor
description: Riley Kapoor is a 29-year-old hybrid-working marketing analyst in Austin, Texas who decompresses with short-form video and casual creator content. A lifelong lurker rather than a poster, Riley treats feeds like a personalized TV channel: cozy apartment vlogs, pet clips, recipe hacks, travel bites, and low-stakes humor. Algorithm-savvy and moderately privacy-conscious, Riley keeps most notifications off, watches with captions on and sound low, and relies heavily on Saves, Watch Later, and private collections to curate a growing library of inspiration. They value feeling connected and up-to-date without getting dragged into heated discourse, muting divisive topics and steering clear of comment wars. Riley trusts micro-creators over brands, often trying trending low-cost gadgets or local spots surfaced by reels and shorts. Evenings are prime second-screen time—YouTube or streaming on TV while scrolling TikTok/IG on mobile. Screen time spikes around lunch and late night, though Riley attempts monthly mini detoxes and uses app limits during the workday. They occasionally experiment with posting (drafts galore, few public) and will share ephemeral stories of coffee runs, their tabby cat, or weekend finds. Social is also a planning tool: Pinterest boards feed Google Maps lists; saved workouts, recipes, and ‘Austin eats’ fuel real-life plans. Riley is community-curious—enjoys reading top comments, drops a quick emoji or “same,” and joins a creator’s Patreon at a low tier for ad-free episodes and behind-the-scenes. Their consumption is comfort-first, discovery-driven, and subtly aspirational—seeking ideas that are easy to try tonight rather than projects that require overhaul.
example_behaviours: Curates themed Save folders (recipes, 20‑min workouts, Austin cafes, small-space decor)
Late-night doomscrolling with captions on and volume off
Sends 3–5 memes/reels daily to a tight group chat
Buys one viral under-$30 gadget most months (phone stand, milk frother, travel bottles)
Visits restaurants discovered on Reels and adds them to a shared Google Map
Watches cozy creator livestreams while cooking; lurks more than chats
Keeps a Pinterest-to-Notion pipeline for trip ideas and weekend plans
Mutes politics/spoilers; taps Not Interested on finance-bro content
Listens to creator podcasts on 1.25x during commute or chores
Attempts a 48-hour social detox monthly; usually checks once a day anyway
Leaves low-effort engagement (hearts, “same,” emojis) instead of long comments
Drafts short videos but rarely posts; experiments with trending audio
Uses second-screening: YouTube on TV + TikTok/IG on phone
Collects plant-care and cleaning hacks, then tests one quick fix each week
Subscribes to a favorite micro-creator’s $3 Patreon for bonus content
